definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: He leaves with a record of 39-6 with 30 knockouts .
sentences.chinese: 他留下了创记录的39胜6败，30次击倒对手。

sentences.english: A storm dumped a record amount of snow on the region on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 周四，该地区遭遇强降雪天气，降雪厚度创记录。

sentences.english: The United Nations says world food prices have risen to record levels.
sentences.chinese: 联合国说，全球食品价格已经上涨到创记录的高水平。

sentences.english: Optimism among employers in Chengdu was at a record high, the survey showed.
sentences.chinese: 调查显示，成都市用人单位的乐观指数创记录新高。

sentences.english: Whether it's a record remains to be seen.
sentences.chinese: 这是否是创记录还有待观察。

sentences.english: Maybe you can, but don’t try and set any records.
sentences.chinese: 也许你可以做到，但是不要试着创记录。

sentences.english: The theatre has broken attendance records for three years in a row. (NETEM 2006, Text 2, Paragraph 5)
sentences.chinese: 戏院的上座率连续三年创记录。

definition: variant of 記錄|记录[ji4 lu4] (but in Taiwan, not for the verb sense "to record")
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
Gundam, Japanese animation franchise/Jean-Luc Godard (1930-), French-Swiss film director
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to renovate/to refurbish/to refresh (computer window)/to write a new page (in history)/to break (a record)
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
